p: Thus, when D0 19 plane (201) was divided into the doublet of orthorhombic (041) and (221) planes during cooling as indicated in Figure 2b, d-spacing of (041) should increase as lattice parameter b increases and c keeps constant, and d-spacing of (221) should decrease as the reduction of a is larger than the increment of b during cooling, which are consistent with the results shown in Figure 4c.
